etymology.interpretation: The term 黄瓜(黃瓜) (huángguā) translates literally to 'yellow melon.' It refers to the cucumber, which is botanically a type of gourd and can have a yellowish tinge when ripe. By naming the cucumber this way, the focus is on its classification among the gourd family rather than its usual green color.

examples.chinese: 我买了一根黄瓜(我買了一根黃瓜)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yī gēn huángguā.

examples.chinese: 我洗了黄瓜(我洗了黃瓜)，切成了薄片(切成了薄片)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐ le huángguā, qiē chéng le bó piàn.
examples.english: I washed the cucumber and sliced it into thin pieces.

examples.chinese: 夏天吃黄瓜(夏天吃黃瓜)，很解暑(很解暑)。
examples.english: Eating cucumber in summer is very refreshing.
